abstract: Richard Beckman, the company’s president for five years, will lead The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard, Adweek and other publications.
snippet: Richard Beckman, the company’s president for five years, will lead The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard, Adweek and other publications.
lead_paragraph: A top Condé Nast executive, Richard D. Beckman, will leave to become chief executive of e5 Global Media, a new company that owns The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard and Adweek, the two companies said Tuesday.

headline.main: A Top Condé Nast Executive Is Leaving
headline.print_headline: A Top Condé Nast Executive Is Leaving

abstract: The art of admitting mistakes without accepting blame will be on display at a Congressional hearing Wednesday.
snippet: The art of admitting mistakes without accepting blame will be on display at a Congressional hearing Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: As America recovers from the worst financial crisis since the Depression, some of the nation’s chief executives are offering that rarest of statements  an apology.

headline.main: For Bankers, Saying ‘Sorry’ Has Its Perils
headline.print_headline: For Bankers, Saying ‘Sorry’ Has Its Perils

byline.original: By Andrew Martin and Micheline Maynard

abstract: In its latest progress report, the White House said both the overall economy and employment are better than they would have been without the stimulus.
snippet: In its latest progress report, the White House said both the overall economy and employment are better than they would have been without the stimulus.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTONThe Obama administration, in its latest progress report on the $787 billion stimulus program, said both the overall economy and employment continued to be in better shape at the end of 2009 than they would have been without the government’s help.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: White House Council of Economic Advisers

abstract: A top Condé Nast executive, Richard D. Beckman, will leave to become chief executive of e5 Global Media, a new private equity-backed company that owns The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard and Adweek, the two companies said Tuesday.
snippet: A top Condé Nast executive, Richard D. Beckman, will leave to become chief executive of e5 Global Media, a new private equity-backed company that owns The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard and Adweek, the two companies said Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: A top Condé Nast executive, Richard D. Beckman, will leave to become chief executive of e5 Global Media, a new private equity-backed company that owns The Hollywood Reporter, Billboard and Adweek, the two companies said Tuesday.

headline.main: Top Condé Nast Executive Leaves for e5 Global
